thread.title: Arsenal News: New Arsenal kits for 2017/18 season leaked | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal News: New Arsenal kits for 2017/18 season leaked | Metro News

author: Metro Sport Reporter For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal News: New Arsenal kits for 2017/18 season leaked | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news metro sport reporter for metro.co.uk

text:
Metro Sport Reporter for Metro.co.uk Thursday 23 Feb 2017 9:30 am 
The 2016/17 season still has a fair distance to run but frustrated Arsenal fans could already be forgiven for wishing they could fast forward to the start of the new campaign. Keep smiling! Mourinho of all people melts hearts with touching message to Ranieri 
Arsene Wenger’s future is far from certain, while star players Alexis Sanchez and Mesut Ozil could also be heading for the exit door and fans are unlikely to be consoled by the fact the only firm plans that appear to be in place concern the new kits. 
The first ‘leaked’ pictures on next season’s strips began appearing on social media on Wednesday and were hardly met with universal approval. A leaked design of Arsenal’s new home kit depicts a two-tone collar (Picture: Footyheadlines.com) 
The best that can be said for the home effort is that it at least sticks to tradition, although the funky collar is sure to attract mixed reviews. 
The less said about the way kit, however, the better. Arsenal appear to be ditching their customary yellow away kit for a turquoise number, reminiscent of recent Barcelona efforts, so at least Theo Walcott will share something vaguely in common with Lionel Messi. Barcelona sported a turquoise number during their Champions League drubbing at the hands of Barcelona. (Picture: Getty) 
It’s unclear as to whether the black monstrosity, complete with garish pink trim, is the third kit or goalkeeping strip. Either way, it’s unlikely to be a big seller!
